sentence.Network_en: I can't countermand an order Winger's given.
sentence.Network_cn: 我无法撤销温格下达的命令。

sentence.Network_en: EXMP : The general countermand the orders issued in his absence.
sentence.Network_cn: 将军撤销了他不在时所发布的命令.

sentence.Network_en: Please countermand our order for same.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French contremander (verb), contremand (noun), from medieval Latin contramandare, from contra- 'against' + mandare 'to order'

entry.tran: (通常指通过下达新命令)取消，撤销(命令)
entry.def: If you countermand an order, you cancel it, usually by giving a different order.

example.ex: I can't countermand an order Winger's given.
example.tran: 我无法撤销温格下达的命令。

means.word_mean: 1. a contrary command cancelling or reversing a previous command

auth_sentence.content: She proposed...a second visit to the shop to countermand the order.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: She proposed...a second visit to the shop to countermand the order.

auth_sentence.content: I can find no one who has the authority to countermand this singularly foolish order.
